feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware improper mail validation vulnerability
entry.content:
Impact

The mail validation in the registration process had some flaws, so it was possible to construct different mail addresses, that in the end result in the same address, which is shared by multiple accounts.

Patches

We recommend updating to the current version 5.7.18. You can get the update to 5.7.18 regularly via the Auto-Updater or directly via the release page. https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/releases/tag/v5.7.18

For older versions you can use the Security Plugin: https://store.shopware.com/en/swag575294366635f/shopware-security-plugin.html

References

https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-5-en/security-updates/security-update-06-2023

References

  • https://github.com/shopware/shopware/security/advisories/GHSA-gh66-fp7j-98v5
  • https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/security/advisories/GHSA-gh66-fp7j-98v5
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34099
  • https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/commit/39cc714d9a0be33b43877044d0b88ea3c6b43f3d
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-5-en/security-updates/security-update-06-2023
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog-sw5/#5-7-18
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gh66-fp7j-98v5

entry.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware dependency configuration exposed
entry.content:
Impact

Due to a wrong configuration in the .htaccess file, the configuration file of Javascript dependencies could be read in production environments (themes/package-lock.json). With this information, the used Shopware version might be determined by an attacker, which could be used for further attacks.

Patches

We recommend updating to the current version 5.7.18. You can get the update to 5.7.18 regularly via the Auto-Updater or directly via the release page. https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/releases/tag/v5.7.18

For older versions you can use the Security Plugin: https://store.shopware.com/en/swag575294366635f/shopware-security-plugin.html

References

https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-5-en/security-updates/security-update-06-2023

References

  • https://github.com/shopware/shopware/security/advisories/GHSA-q97c-2mh3-pgw9
  • https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/security/advisories/GHSA-q97c-2mh3-pgw9
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-34098
  • https://github.com/shopware5/shopware/commit/b3518c8d9562a38615d638f31f79829f6e2f4b6a
  • https://docs.shopware.com/en/shopware-5-en/security-updates/security-update-06-2023
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog-sw5/#5-7-18
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q97c-2mh3-pgw9

entry.title: [admidio/admidio] Admidio Improper Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
Admidio prior to 4.2.9 is vulnerable to Improper Access Control.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-3303
  • https://github.com/admidio/admidio/commit/3d8bafaa4e9b7a314ffdf548622a8c7b38faee8a
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/65d260cc-55a9-4e71-888d-cb2f66c071af
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vmxg-wx6c-4f3r

entry.title: [admidio/admidio] Admidio Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File vulnerability
entry.content:
Admidio prior to 4.2.9 is vulnerable toImproper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File.

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
Content on the groups page required additional sanitizing to prevent an XSS risk. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.2, 4.1 to 4.1.3, 4.0 to 4.0.8 and 3.11 to 3.11.14.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-35131
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=447829
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-76683
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fwfj-8p36-rc64

entry.title: [billz/raspap-webgui] RaspAP raspap-webgui Command Injection vulnerability
entry.content:
Command injection vulnerability in RaspAP raspap-webgui 2.8.8 and earlier allows remote attackers to run arbitrary commands via crafted POST request to hostapd settings form.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30260
  • https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/pull/1322
  • https://eldstal.se/advisories/230328-raspap.html
  • https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/commit/238e1670fcef8b18ec4628ee74fc345607536a16
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hhqm-f4m4-pq39

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Server Side Request Forgery
entry.content:
An issue in the logic used to check 0.0.0.0 against the cURL blocked hosts lists resulted in an SSRF risk. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.2, 4.1 to 4.1.3, 4.0 to 4.0.8, 3.11 to 3.11.14, 3.9 to 3.9.21 and earlier unsupported versions.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-35133
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=447831
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-78215
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xxp4-mf4h-6cwm

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to SQL Injection
entry.content:
A limited SQL injection risk was identified on the Mnet SSO access control page. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.2, 4.1 to 4.1.3, 4.0 to 4.0.8, 3.11 to 3.11.14, 3.9 to 3.9.21 and earlier unsupported versions.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-35132
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=447830
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-77193
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-49mv-vfcp-8gg9
